content.title: 79,000 pass September 2018 board exams for teachers - ABS CBN News
content.desc: ABS CBN News MANILA- A total of 79, 212 passed the licensure examination for teachers given last September, the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced Friday. The PRC said 18,409 elementary teachers out of 90,750 examinees and 60,803 secondary teachers out of 126,582 examinees passed the exams. Of the elementary teachers who passed, 17,200 are first timers and 1,209 are repeaters. For the secondary teachers, 52,453 passers are first timers and 8,350 are repeaters. content.title: Americans Don't Agree On What They Want From Schools. That's OK. - Forbes
content.desc: What do we want out of our schools? It turns out, opinions differ. That is the takeaway from EdChoice’s annual Schooling in America Survey. The survey asked respondents where they would send their children if they had a totally free choice. Thirty-six percent said traditional public school, 13% said charter, 40% said private, and 10% said homeschool (two percent didn’t know). content.title: The U.S. Army is cracking down on potential recruits who can’t pass the fitness test - Fast Company
content.desc: The U.S. Army wants you–to get fit. The military recently announced a new microsite aimed to help potential recruits master the latest reiteration of the Army Combat Fitness Test (ACFT). Those interested in enlisting must be able to perform a three-repetition maximum deadlift, a 250-meter sprint-drag-carry, a two-mile run, and two minutes of hand-release push-ups, among other feats.
